intro: Vouarana guianensis, commonly known as the Guianan vouarana, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are opposite and often have a rough texture. It is often found in moist, shaded environments in the understory of tropical forests.
